title: Drawing, Design for ceiling decoration
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
inscribed:
Upper right corner: 22
Inscription: Fatti Romani con vedute di Ruine (RB'45)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1534. The arch is decorated with one half of a plant. A mean is seated below, holding a compass. The panel in the center shows a trophy. The painting represents a scene of Roman history in a setting of ruins.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for ceiling decoration. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1561
